General_information.Content: This database contains data from international key comparisons for radionuclide metrology since the inception of the international system of reference (SIR) for radionuclide metrology at the BIPM in 1976.
General_information.Note: This version of the machine-readable comparison report is not definitive. The format is under discussion within the CCRI and CIPM to best reflect the requirements of ionizing radiation metrology and to conform to the SI digital framework. Users can use this document to analyse key comparison data and metadata more efficiently with their software. However, users should bear in mind that the format will necessarily evolve in subsequent updates of this key comparison, which will not guarantee the long-term compatibility of their interface.

References.key: Romain Coulon et al 2022 Meas. Sci. Technol. 33 024003 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/ac3fc4
Romain Coulon et al 2023 Meas. Sci. Technol. 34 074009 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/accd0b

key.name: Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Y-88(2004)
key.Reference_of_the_published_comparison_re: Ratel G., Michotte C., Hino Y., BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Y-88 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{88}$Y and links for the 2000 regional comparison APMP.RI(II)-K2.Y-88, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/41/1A/06010}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2004, \textbf{41}, Tech. Suppl., 06010}

key.name: Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Y-88(2011)
key.Reference_of_the_published_comparison_re: Michotte C., Courte S., Ratel G., Kossert K. and N\"{a}hle O., Update of the ongoing comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Y-88 to include recent activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{88}$Y by the PTB, Germany, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/48/1A/06006}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2011, \textbf{48}, Tech. Suppl., 06006}

key.name: Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Y-88(2022)
key.Reference_of_the_published_comparison_re: Michotte C., Courte S., Coulon R., Nonis M., Judge S., Ratel G., Maringer F.J., Brettner-Messler R., Fr\'echou C., Bobin C., Update of the comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Y-88 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{88}$Y to include the 2016 result of the LNE-LNHB (France) and the 2019 result of the BEV (Austria), \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/60/1A/06003}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2023, \textbf{60}, Tech. Suppl., 06003}

key.name: Linked comparison APMP.RI(II)-K2.Y-88(2000)
key.Reference_of_the_linked_comparison: Hino Y., Results from APMP comparisons on radioactivity measurements of $^{58}$Co, $^{88}$Y and $^{166m}$Ho, \href{https://doi.org/10.1016/S0969-8043(01)00225-1}{\textit{Applied Radiation and Isotopes}, 2002, \textbf{56}:1-2, 421-427}

Data_from_LNE-LNHB-2016.key: C.~Michotte, S.~Courte, M.~Nonis, R.~Coulon, S.~Judge, G.~Ratel
4pi PC x-gamma anti-coincidence, 4pi NaI(Tl) gamma counting

For the $4\pi\gamma$ counting method, the detection efficiency was evaluated as 92 % by Monte-Carlo simulation \cite{Thiam C., Bobin C., Maringer F.J., Peyres V. and PommÃ© S., Assessment of the uncertainty budget associated with $4\pi$ $\gamma$ counting, \textit{Metrologia}, 2015, \textbf{52}, S97}.
